bill_title: repeal the real estate recovery fund and to transfer the existing balance to the South Dakota Real Estate Commission.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to repeal the real estate recovery fund and to transfer the existing balance to the South Dakota Real Estate Commission. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. All moneys, including all interest and profits, on deposit in the real estate recovery fund as of the effective date of this Act is hereby transferred to the general fund of the South Dakota Real Estate Commission. Section 2. That § 36-21A-101 be repealed. 36-21A-101. The commission shall establish and maintain a real estate recovery fund, which shall be used to provide a source for payment of unsatisfied judgments obtained by persons aggrieved by the acts of a person licensed under this chapter. The commission shall maintain one hundred thousand dollars in the fund to be used strictly for the purpose of recovery of unsatisfied judgments against licensees. The moneys deposited in the fund shall be invested by the commission by establishing an account with the state investment council pursuant to chapter 4-5, and all interest and profits derived from such investment, if the fund exceeds one hundred thousand dollars, shall be transferred to the commission's general fund. The interest and profits shall be retained in the fund until its total reaches one hundred thousand dollars. Section 3. That § § 36-21A-102 to 36-21A-116, inclusive, be repealed.
